Description: MINTY! Gibson EDS-1275 SG Doubleneck 1990 Cherry + OHSC Attention tone gurus, Lovies Guitars has put up for grabs this Gibson EDS-1275 guitar. The guitar has been well taken care of over the years. It is all original with no mods at all. There are some wear marks on the pickguard but otherwise pretty clean! There are lots of close up images to see the condition for yourself. The guitar plays perfect and has an awesome feel. The necks are nice and straight and the action is dead on. This guitar has a gigantic tone which any Jimmy Page fan would appreciate. Includes Original Gibson hardshell case. Grab it up and save big. Originally introduced as a hollowbody doubleneck model in 1958, the EDS-1275 assumed its more familiar SG-style body shape in 1962. Always one of Gibson’s more esoteric models, the 1275 got its moment in the sun when Jimmy Page began using it for live performances of the Led Zeppelin classic “Stairway to Heaven.” Thirty years later, Page is still the artist most closely associated with this model. This guitar weighs in at 11.3 pounds 12 string neck: .804 at the 1st fret .975 at the 12th fret 6 string neck: .833 at the 1st fret .992 at the 12th fret SKU: 1814 Serial: 94010318 _gsrx_vers_841 (GS 7.0.16 (841))
Title: MINTY! Gibson EDS-1275 SG Doubleneck 1990 Cherry + OHSC
